result.execSummary:
All charges against Brandon M Strong in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon M Strong is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon M Strong

records.addlTxt: Order Regarding Return of Firearms, signed and filed.
Order Regarding Return of Firearms, forwarded to Judge for signature.

Petitioner appears. Christopher L Morgan appears for the County of Milwaukee. 
Case in court for return of property hearing. Petitioner appears without counsel. Petitioner did provide proof of ownership. State conducted a E-Trace and found Petitioner is the lawful owner of the firearm.
County does not object to return of property for reasons placed on the record. 
Court Granted Petitioner's request for return of property.
Return of property hearing on October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Brandon M Strong in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has valid CCW permit. State moves to dismiss. Court orders case DISMISSED.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 9/09/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Brandon M Strong in court.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/7/22 @ 2:30p
